perturbation.original_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement. 5. By the Developer with a 30-day written notice for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment with a 30-day cure period for the client. However, the added clause allows the Developer to terminate the agreement with a 30-day written notice for any reason. This contradicts the initial condition, creating uncertainty about the actual termination rights of the Developer.

perturbation.original_text: E. MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT. The Maintenance & Support is not included in this contract, but we suggest making a plan in the future that includes bug fixing, server monitoring and constant optimization of the apps. 90 days warranty (bugfixing) support is included.
perturbation.changed_text: E. MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT. The Maintenance & Support is not included in this contract, but we suggest making a plan in the future that includes bug fixing, server monitoring and constant optimization of the apps. 90 days warranty (bugfixing) support is included. Full Maintenance and Support will be offered free for the first year and includes server and optimization.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states maintenance and support is not included in the contract. The modified text then states full maintenance and support will be offered free for the first year. This direct contradiction creates confusion regarding the extent and cost of maintenance and support services.

perturbation.original_text:
G. PAYMENT SCHEDULE. The total cost for the development of the project is $ 480,000. - Developer has accepted 4,122,394 shares of Clients common stock in exchange for $180,000 worth of services to be provided. The Shares were paid to INFX Development, LLC. (Certificate # 1054) and accepted by Developer as payment on December 30t h, 2019 Client will form subsidiary and register the new business if necessary.

The Client agrees to pay to the Developer for the development of the project as listed above, the amount of the other $300,000. - according to the following schedule:
perturbation.changed_text:
G. PAYMENT SCHEDULE. The total cost for the development of the project is $ 480,000. - Developer has accepted 4,122,394 shares of Clients common stock in exchange for $180,000 worth of services to be provided. The Shares were paid to INFX Development, LLC. (Certificate # 1054) and accepted by Developer as payment on December 30t h, 2019 Client will form subsidiary and register the new business if necessary.

The Client agrees to pay to the Developer for the development of the project as listed above, the amount of the other $300,000. - according to the following schedule. The client also agrees to provide an additional $50,000 bonus upon completion of the project to the developers, at the client's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original payment schedule only details the payment of $300,000 after shares are given. The added text introduces a discretionary $50,000 bonus. This contradicts the initial fixed payment schedule and creates uncertainty on if the additional bonus must be paid.
